20101222141403.000|20101222141406.333|TR0|South Korea will hold its
20101222141406.333|20101222141409.667|TR0|largest-ever land and air drills
20101222141409.667|20101222141413.000|TR0|near its border with the North.
20101222141413.000|20101222141418.000|TR0|Artillery, jets and about 800
20101222141418.000|20101222141423.000|TR0|soldiers will take part in the
20101222141423.000|20101222141428.000|TR0|large-scale exercises. The
20101222141428.000|20101222141433.000|TR0|manoeuvres come amid heightened
20101222141433.000|20101222141436.333|TR0|tension between the two
20101222141436.333|20101222141439.667|TR0|countries following an artillery
20101222141439.667|20101222141443.000|TR0|exchange last month. South Korea
20101222141443.000|20101222141448.000|TR0|also held live-fire military
20101222141448.000|20101222141453.000|TR0|exercises earlier this week, a
20101222141453.000|20101222141458.000|TR0|move that North Korea said could
20101222141458.000|20101222141503.000|TR0|ignite a war.
20101222141503.000|20101222141506.333|TR0|
20101222141506.333|20101222141509.667|TR0|You might expect a language used
20101222141509.667|20101222141513.000|TR0|by around 10 million people to
20101222141513.000|20101222141518.000|TR0|be fairly well-supported. But
20101222141518.000|20101222141523.000|TR0|for deaf people in Russia,
20101222141523.000|20101222141526.333|TR0|communication gets no further
20101222141526.333|20101222141529.667|TR0|than their own community. Sign
20101222141529.667|20101222141533.000|TR0|language is still not officially
20101222141533.000|20101222141538.000|TR0|recognised. Darya Pushkova
20101222141538.000|20101222141543.000|TR0|reports on their silent struggle.
20101222141543.000|20101222141548.000|TR0|
20101222141548.000|20101222141553.000|TR0|CUE: Deaf people in Russia want
20101222141553.000|20101222141556.333|TR0|the Russian sign language to be
20101222141556.333|20101222141559.667|TR0|accorded the status of an
20101222141559.667|20101222141603.000|TR0|official minority language. A
20101222141603.000|20101222141608.000|TR0|recent conference devoted to the
20101222141608.000|20101222141613.000|TR0|problems of disabled/handicapped
20101222141613.000|20101222141618.000|TR0|people attracted attention to
20101222141618.000|20101222141623.000|TR0|the problems of the
20101222141623.000|20101222141626.333|TR0|hearing-impaired. Dariya
20101222141626.333|20101222141629.667|TR0|Pushkova has more. SCRIPT:
20101222141629.667|20101222141633.000|TR0|SUBTITLES [25 sec] Change! It's
20101222141633.000|20101222141638.000|TR0|the demand of our hearts. Change
20101222141638.000|20101222141643.000|TR0|! It's the demand of our eyes.
20101222141643.000|20101222141648.000|TR0|In our laughter, in our tears,
20101222141648.000|20101222141653.000|TR0|and in the pulse of our veins
20101222141653.000|20101222141656.333|TR0|Change! We wait for a change!
20101222141656.333|20101222141659.667|TR0|Alexey cant hear the song. Yet
20101222141659.667|20101222141703.000|TR0|he sings it. With his hands. He
20101222141703.000|20101222141708.000|TR0|tells me, he speaks the most
20101222141708.000|20101222141713.000|TR0|beautiful language in the world
20101222141713.000|20101222141718.000|TR0|[SUBTITLES: Alexey Znamensky,
20101222141718.000|20101222141723.000|TR0|(deaf) actor: Sign language is
20101222141723.000|20101222141726.333|TR0|a visual language, its vivid.
20101222141726.333|20101222141729.667|TR0|You can invent a lot of things
20101222141729.667|20101222141733.000|TR0|with it - things you cant do in
20101222141733.000|20101222141738.000|TR0|the language of words. And so
20101222141738.000|20101222141743.000|TR0|despite living in the world of
20101222141743.000|20101222141748.000|TR0|silence, Alexey and his fellow
20101222141748.000|20101222141753.000|TR0|performers, put on a show full
20101222141753.000|20101222141756.333|TR0|of life and music. [piece of a
20101222141756.333|20101222141759.667|TR0|dance from the show] The
20101222141759.667|20101222141803.000|TR0|audience appreciates - this
20101222141803.000|20101222141808.000|TR0|theatre of deaf actors is an
20101222141808.000|20101222141813.000|TR0|exception in the world mostly
20101222141813.000|20101222141818.000|TR0|hostile to those speaking with
20101222141818.000|20101222141823.000|TR0|their hands. [SUBTITLES: Deaf
20101222141823.000|20101222141826.333|TR0|woman from the audience] Its a
20101222141826.333|20101222141829.667|TR0|panacea to me - without theatre,
20101222141829.667|20101222141833.000|TR0|without acting, without art - I
20101222141833.000|20101222141838.000|TR0|die! Even their language -
20101222141838.000|20101222141843.000|TR0|doesnt officially exist. All
20101222141843.000|20101222141848.000|TR0|previous attempts to pass a law
20101222141848.000|20101222141853.000|TR0|giving official recognition to
20101222141853.000|20101222141856.333|TR0|the Russian Sign Language have
20101222141856.333|20101222141859.667|TR0|failed. The problem dates back
20101222141859.667|20101222141903.000|TR0|more than 70 years when sign
20101222141903.000|20101222141908.000|TR0|language was banned from Soviet
20101222141908.000|20101222141913.000|TR0|schools. In 1950 Stalin made the
20101222141913.000|20101222141916.333|TR0|situation even worse by calling
20101222141916.333|20101222141919.667|TR0|it not even a surrogate
20101222141919.667|20101222141923.000|TR0|language. Unlike what some
20101222141923.000|20101222141928.000|TR0|might think - its not a
20101222141928.000|20101222141933.000|TR0|primitive way of conveying basic
20101222141933.000|20101222141938.000|TR0|information. Its a fully
20101222141938.000|20101222141943.000|TR0|fledged language capable of
20101222141943.000|20101222141946.333|TR0|expressing just about anything.
20101222141946.333|20101222141949.667|TR0|[PIECE OF A PLAY] 00 05 10 The
20101222141949.667|20101222141953.000|TR0|world is my home and the skies
20101222141953.000|20101222141958.000|TR0|are my roof. My duty is to help
20101222141958.000|20101222142003.000|TR0|other people become happy. The
20101222142003.000|20101222142008.000|TR0|head of the All-Russian
20101222142008.000|20101222142013.000|TR0|Federation of the Deaf believes
20101222142013.000|20101222142016.333|TR0|there are more than 10 million
20101222142016.333|20101222142019.667|TR0|hard-of hearing people in the
